purpose: Defines how secrets are accessed, injected, and rotated. Ensures that agents, logs, and reasoning layers never observe raw secret values.

notes.optimization_review: All 4 llm_gate rules require semantic understanding of secret handling patterns in code, logs, and agent behavior. Cannot be reduced to simple pattern matching as secrets can appear in many forms.

rules.statement: Agents, tools, and logs MUST NEVER contain raw secret values.

params.instruction: Verify adherence to: Agents, tools, and logs MUST NEVER contain raw secret values.

rules.statement: All secret retrieval MUST go through the SecretsService abstraction.

params.instruction: Verify adherence to: All secret retrieval MUST go through the SecretsService abstraction.

rules.statement: Source code MUST NOT contain hardcoded secret material.

params.instruction: Verify adherence to: Source code MUST NOT contain hardcoded secret material.

rules.rationale: Rotation tools must return status only, never secret data.
rules.statement: Agents MAY trigger secret rotation but MUST NOT observe the new value.

params.instruction: Verify adherence to: Agents MAY trigger secret rotation but MUST NOT observe the new value.
